messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] earthquake post explained
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/22/01 11:35:36 AM Central Daylight Time, ... Germany. ... EEEK! ... I m sure that was very scary. I didn t mean to scare anyone or bring
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/22/01 11:35:36 AM Central Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> I only got one empty one so far.
>
> One day I was on instant message with a friend in Seattle right after the
> earthquake (lately) and he said it had stopped. He's from northern
Germany.
>
> I was asking him whether he was aware of aftershocks when he said it's
> starting again, I feel it in my chair, and then he was just offline.
EEEK!
>
> That was scary.
>
> Sandra

I'm sure that was very scary. I didn't mean to scare anyone or bring back
memories of earthquakes. Since you only received one email, and the same may
be true of others, I'll explain what happened.

I was deleting my old mail, using both my mouse and my enter button to speed
things along, and ended up getting way ahead of one of the actions somehow. I
accidentally sent two empty replies to an old earthquake email. I felt like a
complete idiot and decided to just laugh at myself. I hope you don't feel I
was making light of earthquakes.

Cheryl
